Headline: Entrepreneur | Founder @ Adventroz – Travel. Culture. Legacy. | Helping Founders Build Smarter With Tech, Marketing & Capital
Comment:
This hits a nerve Avik Ashar India’s biggest bottleneck isn’t innovation, it’s integrity.
We can build rockets cheaper than NASA, but can’t get a basic approval without “a call.” That paradox says everything.
World Bank data already shows India loses nearly 3% of GDP annually to administrative inefficiency and corruption leaks. That’s trillions in lost compounding.
If AI can remove friction from customer support and logistics, it damn well can remove friction from governance. But it needs intent, not pilots and press releases.
Clean systems don’t just speed approvals, they restore faith. And that’s the real infrastructure we’re missing.
